author: George Orwell
description: A chilling novel of a totalitarian regime's dystopian future.
summary: Winston Smith wrestles with oppression in a totalitarian world.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty exploration of love, class, and marriage.
summary: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love and societal expectations.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A moving tale of racial injustice in the Deep South.
summary: Scout Finch grows up in a town steeped in prejudice and learns life-changing lessons.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A visionary novel exploring dystopian society.
summary: Huxley's dystopia critiques modern consumerism and hedonism.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic saga of revenge and obsession.
summary: Captain Ahab pursues the great white whale, Moby Dick.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about love, wealth, and the American Dream.
summary: Jay Gatsby's obsession with Daisy Buchanan leads to tragedy.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological exploration of crime and morality.
summary: Raskolnikov commits murder and battles his conscience.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bronte
description: A tale of resilience, independence, and love.
summary: Jane Eyre overcomes hardships and finds true love.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A satirical fable about power and corruption.
summary: Animals overthrow humans but recreate tyranny.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A story of sin, guilt, and redemption.
summary: Hester Prynne's life after adultery in Puritan society.
